messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] advice for unschooling workshop
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, My name is Trish and I m unschooling with my two daughters of 12 and 10.  I live in the Far North (Kohukohu, Hokianga).  I m still working at becoming
messages.messageBody:
Hello,

My name is Trish and I'm unschooling with my two daughters of 12 and 10. I
live in the Far North (Kohukohu, Hokianga). I'm still working at becoming
an unschooler. Dealing with my own doubts, etc. I love the unschooling
yahoo group.

Are you going to be at the conference in Whangarei at the end of July?

I'm keen to attend but I'm unaware of dates and times.

Hope you are in the North too and can fill me in.

Warm Regards

Trish Donk
----- Original Message -----
From: "Kerrin or Ralph" <kerrin@...>
To: <AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, June 25, 2004 8:58 AM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] advice for unschooling workshop


> Kia ora from New Zealand everyone!
>
> I've just come off no mail after an overseas trip. I'm looking forward to
some more of the inspiring encouragement I get from this list!
>
> I've been asked to do an hour long unschooling workshop for our local
homeschooling conference next month. There are very few unschooling families
in the area, so most participants are going to be pretty ignorant of
unschooling. I'm fairly confident that I can put something interesting,
informative and fun together, but I would really appreciate any tips, ideas
or advice. Also if anyone has done this kind of thing, I'd love to hear
about how it went.
>
> Thanks,
> Kerrin.
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] advice for unschooling workshop
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/24/2004 6:23:35 PM Eastern Daylight Time, kerrin@xtra.co.nz writes: I ve  been asked to do an hour long unschooling workshop for our local
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/24/2004 6:23:35 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
kerrin@... writes:

I've been asked to do an hour long unschooling workshop for our local
homeschooling conference next month. There are very few unschooling families in the
area, so most participants are going to be pretty ignorant of unschooling.
I'm fairly confident that I can put something interesting, informative and fun
together, but I would really appreciate any tips, ideas or advice. Also if
anyone has done this kind of thing, I'd love to hear about how it went.



<<<

You'd be stealing from Sandra, but I LOVED her "Connections" talk at last
year's Live and Learn Unschooling Conference. She handed out papers with two
dots on them and had people "connect the dots"----BRILLIANT. And the resulting
pieces of art----and some of them *were*----were great fun to look at.

Even neater was that Anne's talk was *also* about connections----totally
unrelated and unplanned!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: advice for unschooling workshop
messages.msgSnippet: Kia ora from New Zealand everyone! I ve just come off no mail after an overseas trip. I m looking forward to some more of the inspiring encouragement I get
messages.messageBody:
Kia ora from New Zealand everyone!

I've just come off no mail after an overseas trip. I'm looking forward to some more of the inspiring encouragement I get from this list!

I've been asked to do an hour long unschooling workshop for our local homeschooling conference next month. There are very few unschooling families in the area, so most participants are going to be pretty ignorant of unschooling. I'm fairly confident that I can put something interesting, informative and fun together, but I would really appreciate any tips, ideas or advice. Also if anyone has done this kind of thing, I'd love to hear about how it went.

Thanks,
Kerrin.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
